channel.title: CVE Feed for ASUS -- RT-AX56U
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ASUS -- RT-AX56U

item.title: CVE-2022-23970|2024-08-03T03:59:23.252Z -- asus -- rt-ax56u
item.description: ASUS RT-AX56U’s update_json function has a path traversal vulnerability due to insufficient filtering for special characters in the URL parameter. An unauthenticated LAN attacker can overwrite a system file by uploading another file with the same file name, which results in service disruption.

item.title: CVE-2022-22054|2024-08-03T03:00:55.327Z -- asus -- rt-ax56u
item.description: ASUS RT-AX56U’s login function contains a path traversal vulnerability due to its inadequate filtering for special characters in URL parameters, which allows an unauthenticated local area network attacker to access restricted system paths and download arbitrary files.

item.title: CVE-2022-23972|2024-08-03T03:59:22.869Z -- asus -- rt-ax56u
item.description: ASUS RT-AX56U’s SQL handling function has an SQL injection vulnerability due to insufficient user input validation. An unauthenticated LAN attacker to inject arbitrary SQL code to read, modify and delete database.

item.title: CVE-2022-23973|2024-08-03T03:59:23.337Z -- asus -- rt-ax56u
item.description: ASUS RT-AX56U’s user profile configuration function is vulnerable to stack-based buffer overflow due to insufficient validation for parameter length. An unauthenticated LAN attacker can execute arbitrary code to perform arbitrary operations or disrupt service.

item.title: CVE-2022-23971|2024-08-03T03:59:23.305Z -- asus -- rt-ax56u
item.description: ASUS RT-AX56U’s update_PLC/PORT file has a path traversal vulnerability due to insufficient filtering for special characters in the URL parameter. An unauthenticated LAN attacker can overwrite a system file by uploading another PLC/PORT file with the same file name, which results in service disruption.
